WES, Wednus Event System

Detailed Description

The implementation of the WES, Wednus Event System.

Variable Documentation

W events = {}
 

Pool for registered event listeners.

Definition at line 11 of file wes.js.

W event
 

Initial value:

 function(source, event, func, arg1){
    var task;
    
    if(!W.events[source])
        W.events[source] = {};
    if(!W.events[source][event]){
        
        W.events[source][event] = [];
        
        source[event] = function(){
            
            for(var i = 0; i < W.events[source][event].length; ++i){
                task = W.events[source][event][i];
                
                task[0](task[1]);
            }
        };
    }
    W.events[source][event][W.events[source][event].length] = [func, arg1];
}
WES implementation.

This function adds an event to the corresponding event library queue and sequentially executes registered event handlers when the target event fires. For example, the following line of code will add an event listener named 'myFunc' to window.onload with its argument set, args. 

 W.event(window, 'onload', myFunc, args);
Parameters:
source the source object of this event
event the target event
func the function object to be added
arg1 the first argument
